Seventeen fourth and fifth-grade RHJ students competed Thursday at the 2020 STEM Wars, hosted at Southwestern Elementary. Young scholars from six area schools took part in the events, which included a Catapult Challenge, a Marble Run, and a Robotic Coding Race. Students also submitted items for a Maker Faire table and developed posters on how to solve the algae bloom problem in Chautauqua Lake.

Our teams earned two third-place awards for the Robotic Coding Race and two second-place awards in the Catapult Challenge, while our Make Faire table received an honorable mention.

The t-shirt worn by team members was designed by RHJ student Skylar Ekstrom and printed by JRSC Digital.

Special thanks to RHJ teachers Mrs. Joan Waterman and Mr. Jason Rappold for facilitating this event for our students! Please enjoy the attached video produced by Mrs. Waterman featuring highlights from the day.

Please deliver your bid(s) to the District offices at 26 Institute St. either in person between the hours of 8 a.m. and 2:30 p.m or via USPS. All bids must be received no later than 2:30 p.m. on Friday, January 24.

Thank you!

On November 23rd, two teams from Frewsburg competed in the FIRST LEGO League regional competition at Nichols School in Buffalo. The teams finished in 7th and 11th places overall.

Team members met with three different panels of judges to demonstrate their robot designs, explain their innovative program designs, and participate in team-building activities. Our team from RHJ participated in a structure challenge, winning first place and receiving free tickets to the Buffalo Museum of Science!

A big thank you to the teams' faculty coach, Mrs. Joan Waterman, and to Mrs. Wendy Sanfilippo and Mr. Dave Goggin for serving as volunteer coaches!
